CatDescriptText: Cutline of image published in Pittsburgh Courier newspaper, November 6, 1948, pg. 10, reads: "AKAR CHORUS - The celebrated AKAR Chorus presents its Hour of Charm this Sunday, Nov. 7, at the Masonic Temple, 2503 Centre Avenue, from four until seven. The musical and semi-revue type of entertainment is under the chairmanship of Mrs. Marie Williams.  A short fashion revue will be interspersed by musical selections by the chorus, and will be one of the affairs not to be missed by Pittsburghers interested in new winter styles and the latest in music. - Harris Photo."
TitMainTitle: Group portrait of women and girls wearing light colored blouses and dark skirts, members of AKAR chorus, posed in interior with wall inscribed "tumbling," "gym," and "horseshoes"
